testItems.title: Natural History Museum, London
testItems.description: The Natural History Museum in London is a natural history museum that exhibits a vast range of specimens from various segments of natural history. It is one of three major museums on Exhibition Road in South Kensington, the others being the Science Museum and the Victoria and Albert Museum.

categoryFields.hightlight: The entry with the big dinosaur!

testItems.title: Accademia Carrara
testItems.description: A small and intimate collection of art started by the Count Giacomo Carrara, a wealthy collector and patron of the arts, who left a generous legacy to the city of Bergamo at the end of the 18th century.

categoryFields.hightlight: Collection was just about the right size. Works by Lorenzo Lotto.

testItems.title: The Eight Mountains: A Novel
testItems.description: The story of two Italian boys, Pietro and Bruno, from different backgrounds, develop an unlikely relationship with the backdrop of the mountains. This novel won Italy's Strega Prize and the French Prix Medicis etranger.

testItems.title: Brief Answers to the Big Questions
testItems.description: The world-famous cosmologist and author of A Brief History of Time leaves us with his final thoughts on the biggest questions facing humankind.

categoryFields.author: Stephen Hawking
categoryFields.theme: Universe, origins, extraterrestial life, future prospects.

testItems.title: Schindler's List
testItems.description: Oskar Schindler, a German businessman, saves the lives of more than a thousand mostly Polish-Jewish refugees from the Holocaust by employing them in his factories during World War II.

categoryFields.synopsis: Good versus evil, redemption during WWII.

testItems.title: Life is Beautiful
testItems.description: The film was partially inspired by the book In the End, I Beat Hitler by Rubino Romeo Salmoni and by Benigni's father, who spent two years in a German labour camp during World War II.

categoryFields.synopsis: Benigni plays Guido Orefice, a Jewish Italian bookshop owner, uses his fertile imagination to shield his son from the horrors of internment in a Nazi concentration camp.

testItems.title: Dinner with Tony and Randy
testItems.description: At the 2-Michelin-Star Restaurant FACIL. We went Tony and Randy for two days in Berlin. They really wanted to come here. Very good experience.

testItems.title: Lunch with Kerri and Steve at Loreley Beer Garden
testItems.description: Good food and beer of course. Came here with Kerri when we stopped in NYC for the day. It's her favorite place to come and grab a beer.

testItems.title: Absalon Einarsson
testItems.description: It happened to be his birthay when we met him; we hit it off right away. Next time in Iceland, call him.

testItems.title: Donizetti Opera Inaugural Concert Teatro Sociale
testItems.description: We particularly liked the 'Oh, giusto cielo!...Il dolce suono' pieces from Donizetti's Lucia di Lammermoor. Donizetti intended the aria to be accompanied by the eerie sound of the glass harmonica, though this instrument is often replaced in performance by a flute.

categoryFields.synopsis: A varied program with pieces from Rossini and Donizetti.
